actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one minute speeches.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that she had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 23, 2022 at 8:25 a.m.: That the Senate agreed to S. Con. Res. 51 and S. Con. Res. 52; passed H.R. 4373, with an amendment; and agreed to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2617, with an amendment.
The Chair designated Mr. Smith of NE to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to section 6 of H. Res. 1529, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable James A. Himes to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
